summary: This is a formal U.S. Department of Justice request to French authorities for assistance in the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell. It seeks to interview a French citizen witness and obtain records from a 2019 search of Jeffrey Epstein's Paris residence. The document outlines the charges against Maxwell, the status of the Epstein investigation, and the need for confidentiality.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with conspiracy, transportation of minors, coercion and enticement, and perjury for her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls from at least 1994 to 1997.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Alleged to have engaged in the sexual abuse of minor girls from approximately 1994 through 2005. Indicted in July 2019, arrested, and died by suicide in August 2019.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged with conspiring with and assisting Epstein in the sexual exploitation and abuse of multiple minor girls.
The document states Maxwell invited the witness to New York, where Epstein subsequently sexually abused her.
The document states the witness was sexually abused by Epstein in New York after meeting him and Maxwell.

events.title: Epstein Indictment
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Jeffrey Epstein with conspiracy to sexually traffic in minors.

events.title: Epstein Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested pursuant to the indictment and detained in New York.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide in his jail cell in New York.

events.title: Search of Epstein's Paris Residence
events.description: French authorities searched Jeffrey Epstein's residence in the Paris 16th district, seizing materials including documents and photographs.

events.title: Maxwell Indictment
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell with crimes related to assisting Epstein's sexual abuse of minors.

events.title: Maxwell Arrest
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested pursuant to the indictment and has been detained pending trial in New York.

events.title: Scheduled Maxwell Trial
events.description: A trial date of July 12, 2020, had been set for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (mentioned as a past date in this 2021 request).

keyFacts: The U.S. is seeking to interview a French citizen witness who was allegedly sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein in New York after being introduced to him and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The request seeks materials seized from Epstein's Paris residence in September 2019, including photographs of women and a CD Rom labeled 'CONFIDENTIAL â€” COMPREHENSIVE CHART'.
The document reveals the U.S. investigation into Epstein and his associates continued after his death and led to Maxwell's indictment.
The U.S. authorities believe the French witness may be a critical witness and the subject of additional charges against Maxwell.
The request emphasizes extreme confidentiality to prevent witness tampering, evidence destruction, or compromising the Maxwell trial.
